meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I tyed my shoelaces before going for a walk.
meanings.sent2: She tyed the ribbon around the gift box neatly.
meanings.sent3: The cat tyed itself in knots playing with yarn.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were tyed up in a tangled mess.
meanings.sent5: The old tree was tyed to memories of childhood adventures.

meanings.definition: fastened or secured with a knot or string
meanings.sent1: The tyed rope held the swing securely in place.
meanings.sent2: She wore a tyed bandana to keep her hair out of her face.
meanings.sent3: The tyed balloon floated gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The tyed package arrived safely at its destination.
meanings.sent5: The tyed knot was strong enough to withstand the strong winds.
